required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adaptive MR-guided SBRT for Localized Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Trial of Individualized Daily Dose Adaptation for Localized Prostate Cancer by Online MR-guided SBRT

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate a technical feasibility of MR-guided SBRT fraction dose adaptation for low-risk, intermediate-risk and low-volume metastatic prostate cancer. .

detailed_description.textblock: Hypofractionated SBRT to 36.25 Gy in 5 fractions (fraction dose 7.25 Gy) for low- and intermediate risk prostate cancer is standard of care. Using higher fraction doses that might be beneficial for disease control is not safe in all patients, unless adaptive treatment is performed. In this clinical trial the feasibility of online MR-guided SBRT fraction dose adaptation (between 7 and 8 Gy) for prostate cancer will be investigated. A fraction dose to the planning target volume (PTV) will be adapted to organs-at-risk (OAR) geometry (position, shape and volume) on online planning MRI scans of the treatment day ("geometry-of-the-day"). Thus the investigators hope to maximize treatment individualization.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of online MR-guided SBRT: Number of fractions
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the treatment end (treatment duration 2 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Number of fractions when a new online plan on the new patient geometry was successfully generated and applied according to the dosimetric protocol requirements

secondary_outcome.time_frame: weekly during treatment and up to 3 months after the treatment end
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse and severe adverse events measured with Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) (version 5.0)

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantifying intrafraction motion of the prostate (in mm) and organs-at-risk (in mm)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During each treatment session (treatment duration of 2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in the organ motion (in mm) during a treatment session

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantifying interfraction motion of the prostate (in mm) and organs-at-risk (in mm)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before each treatment session (treatment duration of 2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in the organ (the prostate and organs-at-risk [in mm]) motion between treatment sessions

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of the adapted treatment plan vs. the initial treatment plan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the treatment end (treatment duration 2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of radiation doses delivered to the targets and organs-at-risk with the adapted treatment plan vs. the initial treatment plan

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of an online adaptive procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before each treatment session (treatment duration 2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Time needed for adapting a treatment plan

arm_group.description: Patients with low-risk, intermediate-risk and low-volume metastatic prostate cancer eligible for stereotactic body radiotherapy will be recruited.

intervention.description: SBRT (a fraction dose adapted to the OAR geometry-of-the-day, 5 fractions) performed on the MR-Linac

patient_data.ipd_description: It is not yet known if there will be a plan to make IPD available.
